Package chess

Class Chess

java.lang.Object
chess.Chess
public class Chess
extends java.lang.Object
Chess is a class that takes care of the game logic of chess. It contains a 2D array of Piece, which is a class for the chess pieces.
Author:
Seok Yim, Mae Khaled

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description

  • Field Details

    • chessboard

      public Piece[][] chessboard
      This is a chessboard of grid size 8 * 8 (regular chessboard). Is a 2D matrix for Piece instances.

    • turn

      public char turn
      Specifies who's turn it is (either is 'w' or 'b', each standing for white and black, respectively). Initial value is 'w', since white starts first in chess.

    • isOver

      public boolean isOver
      Specifies whether the chess game is over or not. Starts out as false.

    • winner

      public char winner
      Field indicating the winner. The 'd' stands for default, and the actual values it can/should hold are 'w' or 'b'.

    • turns_passed

      public int turns_passed
      Tells how many turns have passed since the start of the game. Initial value is 0.

  • Constructor Details

    • Chess

      public Chess()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      The main method.
      Parameters:
      args - the command line arguments

    • initiateGame

      public void initiateGame()
      Starts chess game by doing all the setups required. Takes care of game logic and applying rules.

    • changeTurn

      public void changeTurn()
      Changes turn in chess after one player ends their move.

    • promptInput

      public java.lang.String promptInput​(java.util.Scanner scanner)
      Prompts input from user for the chess game.
      Parameters:
      scanner - Scanner instance used by initiateGame()
      Returns:
      String typed in by user

    • endGame

      public void endGame()
      Ends the ongoing chess game. Also prints out who won the match.

    • generateBoard

      public void generateBoard()
      Generates the Piece[][] chessboard and populates it with the appropriate Piece instances. Row and column length are both 8(regular chess board).

    • showBoard

      public void showBoard()
      Prints the Piece[][] chessboard.

    • canMove

      public boolean canMove​(int sr, int sc, int er, int ec)
      Checks whether the specified piece can move to the specified location.
      Parameters:
      sr - starting row index (row for Piece)
      sc - starting column index (column for Piece)
      er - ending/final row index
      ec - ending/final column index
      Returns:
      true if move specified is valid, false otherwise

    • movePiece

      public void movePiece​(int sr, int sc, int er, int ec)
      This method should be called only when the CanMove() method returned true for the specified pair of sr and sc.

      Moves the piece at the specified location from chessboard[sr][sc] to chessboard[er][ec]. If an enemey piece is killed, remove that piece from the board. This method also takes into account Pawns being promoted after reaching the edge of the board.

      Parameters:
      sr - staerting row index
      sc - starting column index
      er - ending row index
      ec - ending column index

    • movePieceWithPromotion

      public void movePieceWithPromotion​(int sr, int sc, int er, int ec, java.lang.String promoType)
      This method should be called only when the CanMove() method returned true for the specified pair of sr and sc. Also, this method assumes that isValidPromotion() already checked the validity of the promotion.

      Moves the piece at the specified location from chessboard[sr][sc] to chessboard[er][ec]. If an enemy piece is killed, remove that piece from the board. This method promotes Pawns to the specified promoType (Rook,Knight,Bishop, or Queen).

      Parameters:
      sr - starting row index
      sc - starting colum index
      er - ending row index
      ec - ending colum index
      promoType - String that specifies which type of piece to promote to

    • getPiece

      public Piece getPiece​(int row, int col)
      Returns Piece at specified location of the chessboard. Can return null if Piece does not exist at the specified location.
      Parameters:
      row - row index
      col - column index
      Returns:
      Piece or null, depending on whether Piece exists at the specific location

    • isValidPromotion

      public boolean isValidPromotion​(int sr, int sc, int er, int ec)
      Checks whether the move specified for a piece causes a promotion.
      Parameters:
      sr - starting row index
      sc - starting column index
      er - ending row index
      ec - ending column index
      Returns:
      true if piece is a pawn and is allowed to promote, false otherwise

    • checkCheckStatus

      public int checkCheckStatus()
      Determines whether there is a check, a checkmate, or none.
      Returns:
      0 if none, 1 if check, and 2 if checkmate

    • isCheckMate

      public boolean isCheckMate()
      Checks whether there is a checkmate. This mehtod should be called only when a check is detected.
      Returns:
      true is there is a checkmate, false otherwise
